column1: Nala was in her room ready to sleep. Nala wants to have a good night's sleep without any nightmares. The door to Nala's room is locked. Her little brother manages to find the spare key and unlocks the door to her room. Nala doesn't hear her brother unlocking the door as she is listening to music on her headphones.
column2: Does Nala think the door to her room is locked or unlocked?
column3: Nala believes the door to her room is locked.
column4: Nala believes the door to her room is unlocked.

column1: Hugo was in the park with his friends. Hugo wanted to win the kite flying contest. The string of Hugo's kite was strong. A raven flew by and pecked at the string, making it weak. Hugo doesn't see the raven pecking at his kite's string because he is looking at his friends.
column2: Does Hugo think the string of his kite is strong or weak?
column3: Hugo believes the string of his kite is strong.
column4: Hugo believes the string of his kite is weak.

column1: Ravi was at the fish market. Ravi wanted to buy a fish for his mom to cook for dinner. The fish on the scale was heavy. The fishmonger removed the fish guts, making the fish on the scale lighter. Ravi does not see the fishmonger removing the fish guts because he was looking at another fish stall.
column2: Does Ravi believe the fish on the scale is heavy or light?
column3: Ravi believes the fish on the scale is heavy.
column4: Ravi believes the fish on the scale is light.

column1: Vito was at a birthday party. Vito wanted to give his friend a special gift. The gift was wrapped in a shiny paper. A distant cousin, who was also at the party, decided to play a prank and unwrapped the gift when no one was looking. Vito does not see the unwrapped gift because he is still playing games in the other room.
column2: Does Vito think the gift is wrapped or unwrapped?
column3: Vito believes the gift is wrapped.
column4: Vito believes the gift is unwrapped.

column1: Tim was in the kitchen, ready to make lunch. Tim wanted to make a big bowl of pasta. The pasta box was full. While Tim was busy cutting vegetables, his little sister came into the kitchen and took some pasta to play with. Tim does not see his sister leaving the kitchen with some pasta in her hand.
column2: Does Tim think the pasta box is full or not?
column3: Tim believes the pasta box is full.
column4: Tim believes the pasta box is not full.

column1: Wendy was in the park, sitting on a bench. Wendy wanted to play a charming tune on her small flute. The flute was in her bag. A kind lady saw the flute, thought it had been left behind, and moved it to the lost and found box. Wendy doesn't see the kind lady moving her flute to the lost and found box because she is watching the birds.
column2: Does Wendy think her flute is in her bag or in the lost and found box?
column3: Wendy believes her flute is in her bag.
column4: Wendy believes her flute is in the lost and found box.

column1: Gigi was at the park with her friends. Gigi wanted to share her mints with her friends. The mint box was full of fat, healthy mints. A naughty squirrel sneaked up and nibbled on the mints making them sickly. Gigi doesn't see the squirrel nibbling on the mints because she is busy playing.
column2: Does Gigi think the mints in the box are fat and healthy or nibbled and sickly?
column3: Gigi believes the mints in the box are fat and healthy.
column4: Gigi believes the mints in the box are nibbled and sickly.

column1: Remy was in the park playing with his colorful parrot. Remy wanted his parrot to learn a new trick. The parrot was sitting on a clear and open branch. Over time, leaves spread and grew on the branch, obscuring it. Remy doesn't notice the leaves spreading because he is too focused on his game.
column2: Does Remy think his parrot is sitting on a clear and open branch or an obscured branch?
column3: Remy believes his parrot is sitting on a clear and open branch.
column4: Remy believes his parrot is sitting on an obscured branch.
column5: the branch the parrot is sitting on

column1: Pete was at the park, ready to eat his lunch. Pete wanted to enjoy his food while watching the birds. The food in Pete's lunch box was fresh and yummy. A naughty squirrel came and took a big bite out of Pete's sandwich. Pete doesn't see the squirrel taking a bite out of his sandwich because he is watching the birds.
column2: Does Pete think his food is fresh and yummy or bitten by a squirrel?
column3: Pete believes his food is fresh and yummy.
column4: Pete believes his food has been bitten by a squirrel.

column1: Quin was in the park with his gray paint and brush. Quin wanted to paint a big tree on a big balloon. The balloon was empty. A girl nearby had a pump and she filled the balloon with air. Quin doesn't see the girl filling the balloon with air as he is looking at his paint pots.
column2: Does Quin think the balloon is empty or filled with air?
column3: Quin believes the balloon is empty.
column4: Quin believes the balloon is filled with air.

column1: Yara was at a party with her friends. Yara wanted to sing her favorite song for everyone. The microphone was working fine. During the party, a guest accidentally spilled juice on the microphone, causing it to stop working. Yara does not see the guest spill juice on the microphone because she was in the restroom.
column2: Does Yara think the microphone is working fine or has stopped working?
column3: Yara believes the microphone is working fine.
column4: Yara believes the microphone has stopped working.

column1: Sam was at the space station, waiting to travel back to Earth. Sam wants to return home to see his family. The spaceship's launch schedule was synchronized with Earth's rotation. Due to a different calculation made by the space station's computer, the spaceship's launch schedule became asynchronous with Earth's rotation. Sam doesn't see the updated launch schedule because he is busy securing his seatbelt.
column2: Does Sam believe the spaceship's launch schedule is synchronized or asynchronous with Earth's rotation?
column3: Sam believes the spaceship's launch schedule is synchronized with Earth's rotation.
column4: Sam believes the spaceship's launch schedule is asynchronous with Earth's rotation.

column1: Ina was at the park, sitting on a gray bench. Ina wanted to solve the puzzle in her story book. The puzzle in the story book was hard. A kind old man, who was a puzzle master, saw the puzzle and solved it while Ina was away playing. Ina does not see the old man solving the puzzle as she is playing.
column2: Does Ina think the puzzle in the story book is hard or solved?
column3: Ina believes the puzzle in the story book is hard.
column4: Ina believes the puzzle in the story book is solved.

column1: Lenny was at the market to buy a smelly cheese. Lenny wanted to find the best smelly cheese for his mom. The cheese was very expensive. A man at the market dropped the cheese and it got a big rub mark on it. Lenny does not see the man drop the cheese because he was looking the other way.
column2: Does Lenny think the cheese is expensive or damaged and therefore less expensive?
column3: Lenny believes the cheese is very expensive.
column4: Lenny believes the cheese is damaged and therefore less expensive.

column1: Kip was at the mall looking at a beautiful painting. Kip wanted to buy the painting to put it in his room. The painting was very expensive. A big sale started and the price of the painting dropped a lot. Kip does not see the sale sign because he is still in the other store.
column2: Does Kip think the painting is very expensive or on sale?
column3: Kip believes the painting is very expensive.
column4: Kip believes the painting is on sale.

column1: Jake was in the kitchen ready to make dinner. Jake wanted to make a big salad with all the fresh groceries he bought. The knife he uses to cut veggies was very sharp. Over time, the knife became dull from cutting so many veggies. Jake doesn't feel the knife has become dull as he is busy washing the veggies.
column2: Does Jake think the knife is sharp or dull?
column3: Jake believes the knife is sharp.
column4: Jake believes the knife is dull.

column1: Yara was in the kitchen making a sandwich. Yara wanted to find the peanut butter in the cupboard to spread on her bread. The cupboard door was flat and straight. Over time, the heat from the stove caused the cupboard door to warp. Yara doesn't see the warped cupboard door because she is still looking in the fridge.
column2: Does Yara think the cupboard door is flat and straight or warped?
column3: Yara believes the cupboard door is flat and straight.
column4: Yara believes the cupboard door is warped.

column1: Dora was at the library looking for a fun book to read. Dora wants to find a book that will make her laugh. The book Dora wants is on the top shelf. A librarian uses a ladder to reach for a different book, causing the book Dora wants to fall from the shelf. Dora doesn't see the book fall as she is looking at other books.
column2: Does Dora think the book she wants is on the top shelf or on the floor?
column3: Dora believes the book she wants is on the top shelf.
column4: Dora believes the book she wants is on the floor.

column1: Xander was in the forest, looking for deer. Xander wanted to find a deer to take a picture. The deer was hidden in the bushes. A group of birds flew off from a tree and scared the deer out of the bushes. Xander doesn't see the birds flying off and the deer running out of the bushes because he was looking at his camera.

column3: Xander believes the deer is hidden in the bushes.
column4: Xander believes the deer is running out in the open.

column1: Remy was at the park playing with his toy car. Remy wants to stay at the park until the sun goes down. The toy car was fully charged. A squirrel runs over, grabs the toy car, and accidentally turns it on, draining the battery. Remy doesn't see the squirrel playing with his toy car as he is looking at the sunset.
column2: Does Remy think his toy car is fully charged or drained?
column3: Remy believes his toy car is fully charged.
column4: Remy believes his toy car is drained.

column1: Ed was at the airport waiting for his flight. Ed wanted to finish his book before his flight. The bottle of water Ed had was full. A flight attendant passing by accidentally knocked the bottle, spilling all the water. Ed doesn't see the flight attendant knock over his bottle because he is too focused on his book.
column2: Does Ed think his bottle of water is full or empty?
column3: Ed believes his bottle of water is full.
column4: Ed believes his bottle of water is empty.

column1: Caden was at the park playing with his friends. Caden wanted to show his friends his new toy lizard. The toy lizard was clean and shiny. Over time, the toy lizard got dirty from all the playing. Caden does not notice that his toy lizard is dirty because he is too busy playing.
column2: Does Caden think his toy lizard is clean and shiny or dirty?
column3: Caden believes his toy lizard is clean and shiny.
column4: Caden believes his toy lizard is dirty.

column1: Tilly was in the park, sitting on a bench. Tilly wanted to feed the humble rat that visited her every day. The rat was in its hole, not coming out. A cat slowly came near the rat's hole and scared the rat away. Tilly doesn't see the cat scaring the rat away because she was yawning.
column2: Does Tilly think the rat is in its hole or scared away?
column3: Tilly believes the rat is in its hole.
column4: Tilly believes the rat is scared away.

column1: Fergus was at the park playing fetch with his dog. Fergus wants to get his dog to fetch a long stick. The stick was lying on the ground. Over time, the sun dries out the stick making it lighter. Fergus does not see the sun drying out the stick because he is watching his dog.
column2: Does Fergus think the stick is on the ground or has it become lighter?
column3: Fergus believes the stick is on the ground.
column4: Fergus believes the stick has become lighter.

column1: Gabe was at the park with his lovely new cart. Gabe wanted to decorate his cart with shiny stickers. The cart was clean and ready for decoration. column3: Darius believes the ink in the bottle is full and fluid.
column4: Darius believes the ink in the bottle is dry and hard.

column1: Kiki was at the beach with her metal detector. Kiki wanted to collect any gold she could find. The sand was cool and undisturbed. column4: Kiki believes the sand is kicked up and disturbed.

column1: Xander was in the kitchen making breakfast. Xander wanted to make a good omelette for his mom. The egg in the pan was not cooked yet. The gas on the stove slowly ran out, leaving the egg partially cooked. Xander doesn't see the flame on the stove go out because he is looking at his phone.
column2: Does Xander think the egg is still not cooked or partially cooked?
column3: Xander believes the egg is still not cooked.
column4: Xander believes the egg is partially cooked.

column3: Yara believes the ice cream mix is still thick and creamy.

column1: Sam was in the kitchen making a cake. Sam wanted to wash his hands before he started to bake. The sink in the kitchen was clean. Over time, the sink slowly filled with dirty water from the leaking tap. Sam does not see the dirty water in the sink.

column3: Sam believes the sink is clean.
column4: Sam believes the sink is dirty.

column1: Adam was in his lab working on his science project. Adam wanted to finish his project before the end of the day. The lab clock was synchronized with the school's main clock. The janitor, while cleaning, accidentally unplugged the lab clock, making it asynchronous with the school's main clock. Adam doesn't see the janitor unplugging the lab clock because he is focused on his project.
column2: Does Adam believe the lab clock is synchronized with the school's main clock or asynchronous?
column3: Adam believes the lab clock is synchronized with the school's main clock.
column4: Adam believes the lab clock is asynchronous with the school's main clock.

column1: Ollie was in the kitchen ready to make dinner. Ollie wanted to cut some veggies for a fine soup. The knife was sharp and ready to use. As the evening went on, the knife got dull from cutting so many veggies. Ollie doesn't feel the knife getting dull because he is wearing thick gloves.
column2: Does Ollie think the knife is sharp or dull?
column3: Ollie believes the knife is sharp.
column4: Ollie believes the knife is dull.

column1: Benny was at the park near the harmless creek. Benny wanted to sing a new song he just learned. The creek was quiet and restful. A group of ducks landed in the creek, disrupting its quiet flow. Benny doesn't see the ducks landing in the creek because his eyes are closed.

column4: Benny believes the creek is disruptive.

column1: Lenny was in a subway station waiting for his train. Lenny wanted to share his lunch with a friend who was also taking the subway. The tracks for the subway were aligned. column3: Lenny believes the subway tracks are aligned.
column4: Lenny believes the subway tracks were misaligned but are now aligned.

column1: Xander was in the park playing a game of knights with his friends. Xander wanted to be the best knight and protect his friends with his shield. Xander does not see the sun making his shield transparent.

column3: Xander believes his shield is opaque.
column4: Xander believes his shield is transparent.

column1: Noah was at a busy coffee shop waiting for his friend. Noah wanted to buy a coffee and sit with his friend. The coffee machine was working well. column3: Noah believes the coffee machine is working.
column4: Noah believes the coffee machine is not working.

column1: Yesterday, Yara was playing with her favorite toy car in the kitchen. She wanted to make the car do a big jump over the sink. The drain in the sink was closed. column3: Vito believes the bench is dry.

A playful dog runs by, tugs at the kite string and loosens the cable. Hana doesn't see the dog tugging at her kite's string because she is looking up at her kite.
column2: Does Hana think the cable on her kite is tied tightly or loosened?
column3: Hana believes the cable on her kite is tied tightly.
column4: Hana believes the cable on her kite is loosened.

column1: Max was at the park ready to play. Max wanted to play a fun game of hide and seek. The rag he used as a marker was neatly folded on the bench. A gust of wind blew, causing the rag to unfold and become messy. Max does not see the wind blowing the rag as he is looking the other way.
column2: Does Max think the rag is neatly folded or messy?

column1: Uri was in the music room at school. Uri wanted to play a harmless prank on his friend. The piano in the music room was light. column3: Uri believes the piano is light.
column4: Uri believes the piano is heavy.

column1: Yara was at a park playing with her green ball. Yara wanted to play catch with her dad. The ball was very bouncy. A soldier walking by accidentally stepped on the ball, making it less bouncy. Yara doesn't see the soldier step on her ball because she was looking at her dad.

column4: Yara believes her ball is less bouncy.

column2: Does Tia think the cart's wheels are tight and good for rolling or loose and not rolling well?

column4: Tia believes the cart's wheel is loose and not rolling well.

column1: Val was in the kitchen getting ready for a party. Val wanted to make a cold drink for her friends. The metal tie she used to wrap the ice was cold and conductive. Over time, the metal tie warmed up due to the heat from the room. Val didn't touch the metal tie again after wrapping the ice.
column2: Does Val think the metal tie is cold and conductive or warm and conductive?
column3: Val believes the metal tie is cold and conductive.
column4: Val believes the metal tie is warm and conductive.

column1: Gus was at the park drawing pictures with his crayons. Gus wanted to draw a big, beautiful rainbow. The box of crayons was full of many colors. column3: Lenny believes the sand is dense and hard.
